summary: This is a July 2, 2020 press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors between 1994 and 1997, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document details the allegations of grooming and abuse and includes statements from law enforcement officials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and with perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier with whom Maxwell allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who announced the charges and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged actions.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.context: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI's New York Field Office who made a statement praising the victims' bravery.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.context: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department who commended investigators and partners for seeking justice for survivors.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Judge to whom the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is assigned.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Sender of the original DOJ press release email, identified by his email signature.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrest Announced
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and the indictment against her was unsealed. She was expected to be presented in federal court in New Hampshire.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein conspired to sexually abuse minor girls, with victims as young as 14, during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with perjury for making repeated false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, specifically for acts between 1994 and 1997.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a critical role in grooming victims by befriending them, taking them on trips, and normalizing sexual interactions with Epstein.
Maxwell is also charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath during 2016 depositions.
The alleged abuse involved victims as young as 14 years old and occurred in multiple locations including New York, Florida, and New Mexico.
The press release includes statements from top law enforcement officials praising the victims' bravery and condemning the alleged crimes.
